oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: T. G. Sheppard - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews T. G. Sheppard (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of July 03, 1988. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; T. G. Sheppard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming T. G. Sheppard Pulsebeat show -- (00:38) She Didn't Break My Heart (T. G. Sheppard) -- (04:13) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (04:26) Spangler asks Sheppard how 'She Didn't Break My Heart' differs from his previous albums -- (05:28) I Loved Them, Everyone (T. G. Sheppard) -- (08:23) Sheppard calls his time working for Travis Wammack his 'worst days' -- (09:29) I'll be Coming Back For More (T. G. Sheppard) -- (12:08) -- (12:17) Spangler asks Sheppard to request a song -- (12:36) Sunday Morning Coming Down (Kris Kristofferson) -- (16:59) Sheppard recalls how he had first became friends with Elvis Presley -- (17:50) Party Time (T. G. Sheppard) -- (21:10) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (21:28) Spangler asks Sheppard what the biggest lesson he learned from being a lesson producer -- (22:13) Don't Say it With Diamonds (Say it With Love) -- (24:46) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Sheppard, T. G.;
